snippet.title: Evacuations, delays as tanker catches fire
snippet.content:
POLICE are urging commuters to stay clear of the M1 at Loganholme after an oil tanker carrying a "volatile substance" reportedly burst into flames. Emergency services were called to the incident about 8.40am and it is understood one firecrew is currently fight the blaze with three more on the way.
Police are asking occupants of nearby businesses to leave as a precaution - the tanker is carrying a volatile substance.
The extent of the fire remains unknown, but police have warned commuters to avoid the southbound lanes. "The southbound lanes are currently closed, with traffic being diverted off at the Bryant Road exit," police said in a statement. "The northbound lanes may also be required for emergency services, so drivers can expect delays." Police have also asked occupants of nearby businesses to evacuate amid fears the tanker is carrying a "volatile substance". Motorists should exit at Bryants Rd. More to come. Originally published as
